info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN RIPLEY AND NORTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Osgood, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Blooming Grove, Sunman, Metamora, St. Leon, Napoleon, Millhousen, Huntersville, Hamburg, Dover, Ballstown, Penntown, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Peppertown, Lawrenceville and Saint Peter. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
